phrase.item: As-salamu-alaykum!
My name is Shokir Ahmed.
I am from Gulmit, Gojal, Hunza, Pakistan.
Currently I am in the city of Istanbul, Turkey.
I am studying here. So,
I want to tell you a famous story here [in Istanbul] This is how the story starts: Long time ago there was a king. He was a very kind king.
Everyone was happy with him.
So his clan was very happy here.
But he did not have any children.
After praying for a long time, he got a daughter.
They took good care of her. A witch or a Pir [holy person] told them, "Your daughter will go far away from you whenever she grows up".
They got very upset
The king asked his ministers, "How should I protect her?"
So there was a very clever and intelligent ministers,
and he advised [the king], "You should leave your daughter in a place that nobody can reach."
After thinking for a while, a very kind person advised him "You should build a dwelling. Make that place in the middle of ocean
up there and leave your daughter there.
Because of her, all the people around will protect her".
[The king] really liked this idea.
He left from there and after that he ordered, that a beautiful tower be built for his daughter.
After four or five years, they had built a beautiful tower there, only for his daughter, for the princess.
For the princess they built it, and the king brought his daughter and left her there,
as the Pir had told them, "When she grows up, someone will take her away from you."
[The king] was very scared because she was his only child.
He worried so much and left his daughter there.
Even her parents themselves didn't go there, because nobody was allowed to reach that place.
Only one person would come, give her bread [food] and leave --
here, through the ocean.
And so time passed, one or two years, and there was a very brave man, in the middle of the city of Istanbul.
He heard that the princess had been left in such a place.
He really wanted to know: "For what reason had she been left somewhere far from people?"
Then he thought a great deal,
and then he came and saw that place [the fortress] that nobody was allowed to go to.
But he was the bravest young man of his time, he was famous in his time,
and he said, "Whatever happens, I will go to where the princess is."
He was very happy to do so.
On the other side of the tower, from the ocean, he came and there was a garden, he came there with his horse, and saw [the tower] and he said, "I can get there."
According to this story and what people say, he rode his horse across the ocean and came out to this side, fought with the guards, and he killed them all with his sword and came to the princess.
He didn't take her away, but asked, "Why are you here?"
She replied to him, "Well, my parents don't allow me to go out."
He told her, "I will take you away." Then he quickly left from there. He told her [before leaving], "I will come again within a certain amount of time."
The second time-- after that, the next day, he came.
They... Because nobody ever came, he could see that the guards never expected anyone. Because nobody would check if they were alive or dead.
After that, one day he came at night with his horse and took the princess away from there and left that place.
And later, four or five years later, the king came to meet his daughter.
He came, but could not find his daughter there.
The guards thought she was inside.
Because they were also not allowed to go inside to the princess.
So they entered her room and saw that the food was all there but the princess was not there.
Seeing that, the king got very upset. He said, "I will find that person who took away my princess."
So he announced, "Whoever brings me her, I will let them make a wedding [with her]."
So that man heard the [king's words] and took the princess along and came [to the king].
And the king became very happy and then ordered their wedding to be made. After that, they started living in the king's residence.
This tower remained as a memory.
So this story was told in perpetuity, that whoever is brave can go to that tower and come back.

After thousands of years, today it remains as it was in that time. People come here to see the castle and [remember] the story of the princess, and the brave person- the brave young man, and his bravery is praised.
That's all.
Thank you very much!
